modName: Container Magic - Sorted Storage and Retrieval
summary: Adds more options when dealing with containers.
descriptionHtml:
Container Magic gives you automatic sorting power over any container!

100% magic! No containers were harmed in the making of this mod. Meaning, no default (vanilla) game forms are modified, resulting in maximum compatibility with other mods. All game effects are scripted within the spell itself. Container Magic will work on any normal container, and though it probably won't work with special containers, like those added by the 'Automatic Item Storage' mod, it should not conflict with them either!

Uninstalling Container Magic will not affect the containers you have used it on. Neat, huh?

Update version 2.01

Problems reported with the sound of the spell persisting. This update aims at silencing Container Magic completely until I can set it properly. If you already have version 2, updating to 2.01 just involves replacing the existing files or using the NMM. If you are familiar with the CK and have suggestions for what the sound settings for the magic effect should be, let me know.


Installation & instructions


IMPORTANT: If upgrading from version 1, follow the upgrade instructions further below.


This mods requires SKSE.

Use the Nexus Mod Manager, or extract the archive contents into your \Skyrim folder, then activate.

The Container Magic spell will be added to your player the first time you load a game.

Simply cast Container Magic on yourself and open the container of your choice. The Container Magic main menu will appear with all its options.

Transfer times will vary depending on how many items are in inventory. During transfer, player controls are temporarily disabled. For proper results, do not do anything to affect your inventory during this time.


To upgrade properly from version 1:

- deactivate the Container Magic mod
- load a game
- ignore warning that content is missing
- save a game without the mod
- install new version
- activate
- load game saved without Container Magic



Features:



- Store EVERYTHING, including quest items. Be careful!

- various store all unequipped item options



Featured sorting on both Store and Take Menus:



- all weapons or separate out arrows

- all apparel or separate out armor, clothing, and jewelry.

- all ingredients

- all food

- all potions or attempt to sort out medicine or poison potions

- all items placed in miscellaneous

- all literature or separate out books & notes, scrolls, and spell tomes

- all items used crafting or separate out animal parts, metals, and precious gems

- all keys or dragon claws

- all soul gems

- duplicates or copies of all the above



BUTTONS and OPTIONS


[V] - Transfer type selector, choose between:

- All - All items in a category

- Unequipped - All items in a category that are not equipped. Acts as 'All' where not applicable or if Quest Item Safety is on.

- Duplicates - All extra copies in a category are stored or taken.

- Copies - Up to a certain number of copies in a category are stored or taken if available.


[1 / 2] - Select between the 2 main menus.


[Store / Take] - Select between Store and Take options


[M / S / O] - Select between main menu, sub menus if available, and options.


[Safety] - Toggles Quest Item Safety on or off. With Safety on, 'Unequipped' option acts as 'All'.


[Sort Genie] - Experimental eye-candy. Makes it appear a genie is sorting your stuff, though he actually just uses copies. Only works when sorting through apparel and weapons.


[+ Copies] - Raises the number of copies.


[- Copies] - Lowers the number of copies.


[Reset to 1] - Resets the number of copies to 1.



***===WARNING===***


Container Magic will store quest items. Use the Quest Item Safety toggle in options to avoid storing quest items, unless storing quest items is what you want to do.



Other issues:



- Unequipped options now stores copies of the equipped item, but equipped items become unequipped.

- Separating filled and unfilled soul gems not operational.

- No way to separate out enchanted items.

- menu flow may need tweaking


Enjoy!
author: gigantibyte
